qas.question: When will regular flights for passengers from the us resume?

answers.text: Saba has not yet announced when regular flights for passengers from the United States will resume

qas.question: When does saba estimate regular flights for us passengers will resume?

answers.text: the Saba government estimates it should not be expected before 1 October 2020

paragraphs.context: Saba has not yet announced when regular flights for passengers from the United States will resume, but the Saba government estimates it should not be expected before 1 October 2020

qas.question: Which borders are not open for non-essential travel?

answers.text: The borders of Bonaire and Saba

paragraphs.context: The borders of Bonaire and Saba are currently not open for non-essential travel.

qas.question: For travel to st eustatius, what are travellers subject to?

answers.text: travellers are subject to border screening (health & travel history) and a 14-day quarantine

qas.question: When must a c19 test be taken ?

answers.text: before entering the country and on day 12 of quarantine

qas.question: What type of questionnaire must be taken?

paragraphs.context: For travel to St Eustatius, travellers are subject to border screening (health & travel history) and a 14-day quarantine. They must also complete a travel questionnaire and take a C19 test before entering the country and on day 12 of quarantine.

qas.question: What are the isolation rules for residents of saba?

answers.text: Residents of Saba are able to return home to Saba but will have to go into self-quarantine for 14 days

qas.question: Where can residents go upon arrival to saba?

paragraphs.context: Residents of Saba are able to return home to Saba but will have to go into self-quarantine for 14 days, no matter which country they are returning from.
